Title: Vendor Manager, Outbound Pre-Sales
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The OB US Pre-sales team is responsible for connecting and partnering with top merchants across the US. This Vendor OB team works with Offshore vendor partners & front-line salespeople across the globe. This team is instrumental in the acquisition of new customers for the DoorDash Restaurant business. 
About the Role
This Vendor Sales Manager (T6) role supports the rapid growth that were seeing within the wider Outbound Pre-sales team.  Youll have the opportunity to leap directly from an IC or Team Lead role to leading frontline leaders with our vendor partners.  You will work closely with our cross-functional internal partners (training and S&O primarily). This is an exciting opportunity to help create a DD org thats still in its early stages and work with international partners, allowing for remote work and occasional travel both domestically and internationally.
Some of the responsibilities required by the Vendor OB Manager include:

Team Training, Coaching & Support: Provide regular team training to operations and quality leaders as well as coaching guidance and support based on weekly performance readouts from the operations leaders.
Performance Data Strategy & Analysis:  Help analyze team level data and create action plans for front-line leaders and sales agents. Formulate action plans and complete project work that will drive results for company goals, interim special projects and initiatives.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work with all SMB teams as well as business partners in Strategy & Operations  to understand best ways to support mutual success and drive toward KPIs.
Build and Scale: Collaborate on new infrastructure, systems and processes for new teams functions,and initiatives. This may include BPOs or new teams, by taking on various launch and ramp activities with scalability in mind.

Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Be an important part of our leadership team as you will bring new ideas, processes, and training to help us build our Vendor OB Team.
Utilize your honed leadership skills with the opportunity to leap directly from a front-line leader or individual contributor role to supporting frontline leaders, moving quickly through the management development path.
Work in collaboration with cross-functional partners beyond your immediate role, helping you develop new working relationships.
Use your sales coaching and training skills to boost others and measure impact.
Work with both our US DoorDash leadership team, as well as our international vendor partners, allowing for remote work and occasional travel to team meetings, and vendor site visits.

Were excited about you because...

You have a hunger to learn, a curious mind, and receive/give feedback well to create an environment of positive and constant improvement. 
You know how to be a top performer, increase productivity and you've helped others do the same, as a mentor, trainer or team lead.
You're able to navigate sales tools (e.g. SFDC, Outreach, Chorus, GSuite) easily, and have an analytical mind to compile and utilize data. 
You are resourceful, organized, an independent worker, and able to navigate sales rules of engagement.
You are patient and passionate about serving others and assisting in their development.
You can form working relationships with peers, managers, and colleagues at all levels.
You embrace other cultures and are willing and able to travel internationally if needed.  
You communicate well, and being multilingual is a plus.

Title: Sr. Associate, Dasher & Logistics, S&O
Location: New York, NY; San Francisco, CA
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Strategy & Operations - Dasher / Logistics team is responsible for supporting DoorDashs growth through ensuring fast and on time deliveries and the ability to grow and maintain a fleet of Dashers. Our team is building the Local Commerce Service Partner (LCSP) program to ensure customers experience exceptional delivery experiences as DoorDash continues to grow.
The LCSP program enables DoorDash to partner with local entrepreneurs, who operate their own businesses to deliver orders and perform tasks through the DoorDash platform. An LCSP will offer full-time and part-time employment opportunities to the LCSPs fleet of Delivery Associates
On the LCSP team, you will dive into data to explain delivery quality performance at the lowest level of detail, devise high-impact strategies and work side-by-side with external teams to put those strategies into action.
Our best Associates are data-driven, truth seekers, strategic thought partners, operators, and have exceptional relationship-building skills. They combine business context and analytics to take a problem area and implement a customized solution. Think this is you? Read on...
About the Role
As we scale the LCSP program, were looking to hire a Senior Associate to focus on the LCSP platform, delivery quality and partner success. In this role, you will be responsible for launching initiatives to deliver targeted volume, cost and quality business outcomes for the LCSP program. You will dive into data to ensure were building products that closely align with business needs. 

Analyze - Build models to evaluate the costs and benefits of of various LCSP initiatives and experiments
Strategize - Define recommendations that improve daily operations of LCSP program, leveraging a deep understanding of LCSP owners, Delivery Associates, and DoorDash business needs
Collaborate - Influence and engage across the company - partner cross-functionally with our Operations, Analytics, Merchant, Product, Engineering, and Insurance teams.
Experiment - Use data-driven decision making and sound business judgement to run tests to determine the best way to effectively grow the LCSP program

Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Dive into data and obsess over the details to make sure we create value for our LCSP owners and Delivery Associates, as well as merchants and consumers.
Run experiments from hypothesis to final implementation to measure the effectiveness of new products and processes.
Generate insights from analyzing complex data sets that enable future LCSP program success 
Grow an impactful product within a high-growth business 
Work closely with cross-functional partners from Operations, Analytics, Product, Engineering, and Insurance to drive strategy and execution 

Were excited about you because...

You have a Bachelors degree or higher 
2-4 years of relevant experience in consulting, strategy, or operations; high-growth or early-stage startup experience is a plus
You are analytical. You are comfortable with SQL and building models in Excel.
You are a data driven decision maker. You use data to root cause problems and are comfortable executing A/B tests from start to finish to understand how initiatives impact business outcomes.
You are an owner. You imagine, develop, and execute workstreams from inception to completion with little oversight. 
You have a bias for action and are comfortable operating in ambiguous situations.
You are an excellent communicator. You are able to share data insights and business recommendations with various stakeholders across the business to drive action and achieve big goals.

Title: Engineering Manager, Infrastructure (Compute or Traffic)
RoleDescription:
About the Traffic Team
The Traffic team owns the critical path between our customers and our services. Were responsible for routing, ingress/egress, service discovery, and mesh infrastructure that enables secure, reliable, and observable communication across our systems. At our scale, milliseconds matter and resiliency is non-negotiable.
We build and operate foundational components like our Envoy-based service mesh, global load balancing, zero-trust networking, and network observability systems. Were also driving strategic initiatives around multi-region routing, intelligent failover, and edge-to-mesh traffic optimization.
The challenges are complex, often cross-cutting, and require a mindset that blends systems thinking with pragmatic execution. If you enjoy working at the intersection of performance, reliability, and distributed systems and you like proving it with data then youll thrive here.
About the Compute Team
The Compute team powers everything that runs inside our platform. We provide the infrastructure and automation that enables engineers to build, ship, and operate services at scale with confidence. Our work touches everything from container orchestration and scheduling to provisioning, runtime optimization, and developer experience.
We manage our Kubernetes-based platform, CI/CD pipelines, and core abstractions that simplify complex infrastructure for internal teams. Were focused on leverage, building self-service, scalable, and secure systems that help product teams move fast without sacrificing reliability or cost efficiency.
This is a team where foundational engineering meets platform strategy. Were deeply invested in automation, observability, and doing infrastructure the boring way by making it robust, reliable, and invisible when it needs to be.
About the Role
Were hiring an Engineering Manager to lead one of our core infrastructure teams, Traffic or Compute. In this role, youll drive the technical vision and execution for building highly available, cost-effective, and performant infrastructure. Youll partner with senior engineers and cross-functional stakeholders to design and operate systems that power our platform's reliability and scale. Whether its service mesh, Kubernetes orchestration, or cloud integration, your team will be at the heart of solving some of our toughest engineering problems. We work with technologies like AWS EKS, Python, Terraform, and Buildkite, but were just as excited about what we havent discovered yet. This is an opportunity to lead a team at the frontier of cloud infrastructure, with room to experiment and innovate. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead and mentor a team of experienced engineers, fostering a culture of excellence, inclusion, and ownership
Champion data-informed decision-making and continuous improvement across the team
Oversee the design and operation of scalable, reliable infrastructure, while proactively managing down technical debt
Collaborate with product and engineering leadership to drive long-term architectural direction and influence company-wide strategy
Guide the team through ambiguity, leveraging industry best practices while also knowing when to break the mold
Communicate with clarity, whether explaining a trade-off to execs or mapping technical strategy across teams
Drive alignment across teams and disciplines, leading high-impact cross-functional initiatives
Stay current on the latest trends in cloud infrastructure, and bring back ideas worth pursuing
Build, sustain, and grow a diverse team to address the growing needs of the organization

Were excited about you because you have...

7+ years of hands-on software development, including experience at scale with Kubernetes or service mesh with 3+ years designing and operating cloud-native systems in AWS, Azure, or GCP
2+ years leading engineering teams
Experience managing infrastructure teams with high operational standards and a culture of innovation
Built or scaled traffic systems (L7/L4 routing, load balancing, traffic policy) or youve led compute platform teams working with scheduling, orchestration, or provisioning with Kubernetes at scale
A strong bias for action, pragmatic problem-solving, and technical depth
Demonstrated success leading cross-functional initiatives with measurable impact

Title: Shift Lead - Northeast Minneapolis
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated and experienced individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations.  In this role, you will work within a local-fulfillment center supporting Site Management running great shifts and delegating tasks. As a Shift Lead, you will have shift responsibility for fulfilling orders in a warehouse environment, maintaining inventory, and in some locations, this involves preparing food in a light-prep kitchen.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Be an Owner: Take ownership of your assigned shifts including warehouse and kitchen processes, safety/cleanliness, quality, and training. Maintain accountability for inventory, equipment, and other company assets to ensure they are properly handled, stored, and protected from loss or theft.
Delight Customers: Ensure customer orders are delivered with high quality by executing orders accurately, communicating with customers when issues arise, and making sure Dasher pickups go smoothly. 
Lead: Guide Operations Associates through their shift by ensuring the team works safely and productively, and serving as the point of escalation for daily operations.   
One Team One Fight: Support operations in both the warehouse and kitchen, assist with day-to-day tasks, and lead by example.You will be expected to engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse while providing a high-quality experience for our customers.
Help improve Operations: Contribute ideas to improve our quality and customer experience. 

Were excited about you because...

Youre self-motivated, positive, and a team player. You work well with others, and you bring a great attitude to your work each and every day.  You have high integrity and are excited to delight customers.
You have a proven track record of success in food and beverage, warehouse, and/or retail environments.
Youre able to be on your feet, and move heavy products. You are excited and physically able (with or without accommodation) to lift up to 50 lbs depending on the needs of the specific site and can operate a pallet jack and hand truck.
You have the ability and desire to obtain and maintain a food handling certificate. (DoorDash will provide this training)
You have a high school diploma or GED equivalent. A college diploma is even better but not required. 
You are at least 18 years of age.
You're organized and proficient in Google Docs and Google Sheets.
You have flexibility in your schedule. Depending upon the scheduling needs of the hiring site, you can be available for a number of different shifts a week.

Market Competitive pay 
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
401k match
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription including access to HBO max and Lyft Discounts

Title: DashMart Team Member - Gravesend
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 for full-time employees (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

We're excited about you because...

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties
You have experience within retail, customer service, food and beverage, administrative, healthcare or similar industries where you perform a variety of tasks
You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers
Youre able to be on your feet and handle warehouse duties including lifting up to 50 pounds (depending on site requirements) with or without accommodations. 
You have a minimum of a High school diploma or GED equivalent and are 18 years of age or older.

Title: Associate, Workforce Planning Scheduler
RoleDescription:
About the Team
As one of DoorDash's core operations teams, Support Ops ensures that when there are bumps in the last mile there's always someone there to help make things right. Our team designs, manages and operates DoorDash's massive and growing global network of support centers, with the ultimate goal of delivering an outstanding customer experience every time.
About the Role 
As part of DoorDash's Support Operations Team, we're looking for an experienced Workforce Planner to help develop and scale our support lines of businesses. This role will help schedule our monthly, daily, and hourly staffing levels and ensure we're providing our customers with excellent service with up to date hiring plans. You will play an important part in improving schedule efficiency, reporting, and planning around floor staff utilization.
In this role you will:

Build support ramps and schedules at a weekly, and interval level for a large, 24/7/365 organization.
Build and improve reports on agent staff utilization and schedule optimization, both globally and by line of business.
Schedule shifts for support, and allocate PTO allowances by line of business.
Analysis on historical data to provide insights that improve support operations.
Guide Short-Term staffing adjustments to address current staffing gaps.
Build shift-bids and schedules for pilots, internal support teams, and for business operations.
Work with our operations team to track how our staffing is being implemented and optimized. Make decisions on future possible issues and corrected improvements.
Partner with Real Time Analysts for demand insight and outage reporting.

You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Collect and analyze information to ensure data-driven results - you love getting into the weeds.
Enjoy attacking complex problems and building something that hasn't existed before.
Are efficient and orderly in accomplishing a task through concern for all the areas involved, no matter how small; have outstanding direct and clear written and verbal discussions.
Display the ability to keep all parties involved updated and  you can implement and finish the task at hand.
Enjoy a comfortable team-oriented environment where things are always happening at a rapid pace and you can prioritize and organize tasks simultaneously.
Manage outcomes and be empowered to make the decisions to lead to those outcomes.
Be focused on quality, output-motivated, an extreme achiever who is progressive, and always pushing yourself to do better.

We're excited about you because... 

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
Minimum of 2 years of workforce planning or other relevant experience.
Scheduling experience across multiple inbound channels (Chat, Phone, Web, Social)
Experience with Workforce Management software, Assembled. (e.g., NICE, Verint, Aspect, Assembled)
Fluent in Excel formulas and Erlang calculations
Experience with outsourced customer support vendors
Experience with Salesforce

RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDashs Public Policy & Social Impact Team advocates for legislation that supports the health of our business and empowers our community of Dashers, local business partners, and consumers. Through our advocacy on cutting-edge public policy issues and the programs that we develop, we are shaping the future of local economies. This unique team combines direct engagement with policymakers at all levels of government, advocacy campaigns, policy research and analysis, and programs to promote economic vitality,  safety, and sustainability. 
About the Role
DoorDash is hiring an experienced political advertising, marketing, and social media professional to lead our Policy Marketing function. Reporting to the Head of North America Public Policy, you will be responsible for all aspects of policy paid media, our creative studio, social media strategy, policy reputation, and campaign analytics. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Have the opportunity to lead a cutting-edge in-house policy marketing function, with the opportunity to develop, test, and scale new strategies across owned and paid media. 
Design and execute next generation policy marketing campaigns that drive positive outcomes on issues ranging from the future of work, to support for small business, to affordability and food access. 
Manage a dynamic team of policy paid media professionals and contract firms that are responsible for executing seven figure campaigns, from campaign design and content creation, to ad buying, to campaign evaluation. 
Partner closely with teammates across the Policy, Communications, and Marketing teams to harness their collective resources and expertise toward shared objectives. 
Manage and approve budget activity for the Policy Marketing team and ensure that other resources for priority issues and opportunities are provided. 
Develop a deep understanding of business priorities and legislative trends to inform our reactive and proactive work around the country. 

Were excited about you because you have...

Demonstrated the ability to shape public opinion on politics and public policy at the highest levels. We are looking for at least 10 years experience in fast-paced corporate public policy environments and/or successful national political campaigns. 
A hunger to stay at the cutting edge, try new things, iterate, learn, and constantly improve.
A sharp analytical mind and an obsession with measuring the things that matter. You are a master of targeting, testing, and analytics. You will have mastered real time reporting and trend analysis strategies. 
A strong point of view on and experience developing creative content across different mediums, from TV to social media. A devoted following from the people you have led, including in-house teams and external consultants. We believe strongly in supporting and growing our talent at DoorDash and are looking for a leader who is passionate about supporting their teams growth and development.
A successful track record of designing and running non-traditional policy marketing efforts that leverage new media platforms that meet our audiences where they are. 
An operational mindset that enables you to seamlessly manage internal and external processes and stakeholders. 
Successful experience engaging policy stakeholders through organic and paid social media strategies. 

Bonus Points

Experience in the tech industry, particularly the on-demand economy.
Knowledge of the policy issues including the future of work and support for restaurants and other small businesses.

Title: DashMart Team Member - Denver
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance

Health benefits starting Day 1 for full-time employees (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties

You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers
Youre able to be on your feet and handle warehouse duties including lifting up to 50 pounds (depending on site requirements) with or without accommodations.

Title: Assistant Site Manager
RoleDescription:
About the Team
Were looking for a people-focused associate leader to help the Site Manager lead one of our DashMart facilities. DashMart is a new convenience and grocery store from DoorDash, focused on delivering household essentials, favorite snacks, and light groceries right to our customers doorsteps on-demand. 
About the Role
In this role, youll work within a 5-10k sq ft distribution center, will assist in leading the local warehouse operating team, and help the Site Manager ensure we maintain high quality for our customers. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead: Youll demonstrate compassion and commitment to inclusivity as you lead a team of hourly Operations Associates and Shift Leads. Youll hire, coach and develop high-performing team members, while building a safety-first culture where employees are excited to drive success, personally and for the team. Youll serve as a leading change agent for your site, helping your team to navigate new initiatives and growth projects. Youll tackle onsite escalations, including coordination with cross-functional partners. 
Operate: With your thumb on the pulse of all outcomes for your team, you will be directly responsible for driving results in one or more specific focus areas or a specific shift for your site. To achieve your performance targets, youll drive success through effective scheduling and by executing inventory management processes and deploying best practices from across the network. Youll engage cross-functional partners as needed for support. 
Strategize: Within the focus area(s) assigned by your Site Manager, youll analyze data and make strategic recommendations and execute actions regarding resource allocation, workflow, warehouse organization and when to engage cross-functional partners. You may also lead some process improvement projects. 
Delight: We are customer-obsessed. Youll coach and empower your team to provide a highly quality customer experience with every order. Quality metrics such as order accuracy and fulfillment speed will be key measurements of success for your team. Youll also work cross-functionally with central teams from our inventory to training teams to ensure your team has the tools and resources theyll need to deliver. 

Were excited about you because... 

Youre a proven leader. You have managed high-performance teams of 5+ employees with successful performance and employee development outcomes.
You relish ownership. Youre excited to have ownership in a new and rapidly growing business. No problem is too big or too small for you, and youre ready to show up however needed for your team. 
You solve problems from first principles.  Youre excited to solve problems in innovative ways, and you resist this is how its always been done thinking.
Youre unafraid of ambiguity.  Rapid change and learning is exciting to you, and you thrive in ambiguous, startup environments.
Youre analytical. You let data win arguments. You are a data-first problem solver and you have experience using Excel or Google Sheets to analyze data, including using basic formulas and creating pivot tables. 
You have 3+ years experience: In Operations, Warehouse Logistics, Customer Service, Retail Management, Fulfillment, or related field
You have 1+ years of experience managing a team 
You have flexibility in your schedule. As the leader of the site, you will need to ensure your team and the site is fully supported, which will include regularly scheduled late-night and weekend hours.

RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash Drive is looking for you to join our team as a Regional Operations Manager, Parcel on our New Verticals team. DoorDash Drive is our company's hyper-growth platform team serving restaurants, grocers and retailers across the United States, Canada and Australia. The business line youll be supporting is fast-growing, fast-paced, and is obsessed with efficiency. We are looking for someone to manage daily site regional operations via our 3P relationships.
About the Role
The Regional Operations Manager, Parcel will own the day-to-day operations in a specific region within the U.S. They will work with both internal and external stakeholders to manage site operations. This role reports directly to the Senior Manager, Parcel. We expect this role to be up to 40% travel. East Coast or West Coast timezone is required.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Own: From first principles, you will oversee the day-to-day operations of 15-20 locations, ensuring all site processes run smoothly, efficiently and safely.
Strategize: Design, build, and execute process improvement projects to drive operational efficiencies and improve service quality and reliability.
Delight customers: Work cross-functionally with central teams to ensure your portfolio of sites offer customers the best experience on each and every order and your team is equipped with the tools, resources and support needed to achieve these goals. 

Were excited about you because...

You solve problems from first principles. Youre excited to solve problems in innovative ways and you resist this is how its always been done thinking.
Youre unafraid of ambiguity. Rapid change and learning is exciting to you, and you thrive in ambiguous startup environments.
Youre analytical. You let data win arguments. You are a data-driven problem solver with excellent Excel / Google Sheets / data analysis skills.
Youre a proven leader. You have 5+ years of leadership experience and have managed leaders in an operations heavy environment.
You go high and you go low. Youre able to flex between day-to-day operational details and strategic planning. Youre able to take insights from time spent on the floor and distill them into actionable and scalable initiatives for the business.
You act like an owner. You take initiative to drive incremental improvement to the operation and manage the business as if it were your own.
You must have a 4 year college degree.
You have 4-6+ years experience in on-the-ground warehousing or logistics, preferably in the 3PL space.
You have familiarity with SQL.
If internal, you qualify for internal mobility guidelines.

Bonus Points:

You have experience starting or scaling a successful start-up.
You have a demonstrated interest in logistics, on-demand services, and marketplaces.
You have multi-unit management experience
You have experience working with 3PLs
You have built and trained high performing teams.

Title: Real Estate Portfolio Administrator
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Portfolio Administration team is a crucial function within the DoorDash Finance team that sits on the Workplace, Facilities and Real Estate organization. This team manages the overall operations of our facilities and the Portfolio Administration team is critical in ensuring all lease data is accurately abstracted, reported, and communicated.
About the Role
DoorDash is looking for a Real Estate Portfolio Administrator to report to the Associate Manager, Portfolio Administration. In this role, you will manage all lease obligations and support the scaling of our diverse real estate portfolio, as we expand and evolve to support our business. 
You will need to be a master at handling multiple tasks and projects with a no-job-is-too-small attitude, an ability to take thoughtful initiative, and the desire to go above and beyond. 
You will ensure compliance in lease reporting, auditing and approving lease abstractions, assist with portfolio planning, and other ongoing portfolio management activities to maintain accurate records utilizing systems and software in place. You will ensure data is reported accurately with the ability to generate, analyze, and distribute ad-hoc reports.
This role will require exceptional communication and organizational skills, strong attention to detail, resourcefulness, and the ability to work well with a diverse range of cross functional partners. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Be a critical team member in the management of our expanding global portfolio, including tracking critical dates and driving strategic real estate decisions.
Review and approve new lease/amendment abstractions to ensure 100% accuracy in our lease database and administration system. 
Partner with our Construction Management team to review Construction timelines to ensure recovery of all TIA.
Work closely with Lease Accounting to ensure full sox and FASB 842 compliance. 
Work with Landlords, Transaction Management and Construction teams on assorted post-lease documentation including Commencement Date Agreements, Estoppels & SNDAs. 
Contact Landlord regarding maintenance and repair issues related to the building and common areas that are Landlord's responsibility under the Lease and monitor the progress.
Coordinate sublease projects with subTT and obtain Landlord approval.
Provide ownership responsibilities to all Cross Functional Partners (Facilities, Construction, Security, Lease Accounting)  per the Lease.
Work with legal to resolve interpretation discrepancies, and issue notices to Landlords.
Work with Lease Accounting to issue invoices applicable to the Lease language.
Interact with Landlords in order to facilitate completion of paperwork required under the Lease, and walk them through the provisions, if necessary.
Establish timely deadlines with the Landlord for self-help rights if not established in the lease and inform Facilities of expectations.
Monitor and collect reimbursements from Landlords for lease cap, self-help and security deposits.
Work alongside internal and external audit teams to ensure a seamless and successful audit process.
Foster strong relationships with cross-functional partners and ensure alignment across the organization.
Report and monitor Critical dates for lease/option renewals, terminations and other key milestones.
Partner and hold our third party vendor accountable to the reconciliation of monthly payments.
Partner with our third party vendor as needed to research and resolve payment disputes with Landlords.
Liaise with multiple teams; Real Estate Transaction, Lease Accounting, Facilities, Construction,  Legal, Procurement, Risk & Insurance and our third party team.
Support the preparation of monthly portfolio metric reporting.
Support special projects and assignments as required.
Develop and maintain process playbooks.
Review and audit CAM reconciliations.

Were excited about you because you...

Are Customer Obsessed with a passionate drive to, take initiative, and offer unique solutions that deliver on their expectations.
Think big, and Start Small with a thoughtful process of analyzing data and circumstances to solve problems and reach a well-reasoned solution.
Value our One Team, One Fight mentality by partnering effectively to execute on our common goals in a pleasant and energetic manner.
Have a Bias for Action with an appreciation and understanding of our mission in order to make sound, timely contributions.
Strive to be 1% Better Everyday with your openness to new ways of thinking and acquiring new skills to retain a competitive advantage.
Choose Optimism and Have a Plan, whether it's a big project or impromptu task, you are quick on your feet and happy to contribute in a helpful, organized way.
Be an owner, no problem is too big, too small or outside of your scope. You always jump in and help.
Operate at the lowest level of detail, You are a detail-oriented individual who thrives on managing deadlines and accurately performing your work. 
Have a strong understanding of lease agreements, terminology, lease accounting principles. 
Have 3+ years of experience managing a global real estate portfolio. You bring expertise and understanding of commercial leases including extensive exposure to office and commercial portfolios. 
Have a bachelors degree or equivalent work experience
Expertise in understanding and interpreting complex lease language and CAM charges
Proficiency with lease database tools
Understanding of legal terminology as it pertains to leases and real estate
Ability to understand, abstract, and communicate lease requirements to stakeholders
Excellent written, verbal, analytical, and research skills required
Salesforce, Smartsheets, LeaseCalc, Google Suite experience a plus

The Global Safety and Security team advances DoorDash by protecting people, property, operations, brand, and reputation. You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Directly influence business development and guide risk intelligence and investigations operations.

Help develop risk intelligence and investigations programs.
Use your experience building, implementing, and driving the execution of risk intelligence and investigations programs.

Develop operating procedures and program documentation.
Partner with internal customers and teams to reduce loss and increase profitability.
Establish and lead working groups that meet to understand strategies, roadmaps, and projects, and advise on risks and actions to be taken.

Have experience building, implementing, and measuring risk.
Have experience leading projects from design to successful completion.
Understand and participate in tactics, operations, and strategy, and excel at execution in service of a larger mission objective.
Have experience handling discrete information and working with confidential data.
Have experience using technology and data resources for the analysis of risk.
Take radical ownership of your work and performance
Have experience with risk mitigation strategies.
Have a very high level of execution and can work independently and as part of a team.
Can travel as required.

Title: DashMart Team Member - Godwin Heights
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 for full-time employees (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

We're excited about you because...

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties
You have experience within retail, customer service, food and beverage, administrative, healthcare or similar industries where you perform a variety of tasks
You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers
Youre able to be on your feet and handle warehouse duties including lifting up to 50 pounds (depending on site requirements) with or without accommodations. 
You have a minimum of a High school diploma or GED equivalent and are 18 years of age or older.

Support various tax process improvement initiatives
Support tax controversy efforts

Title: Senior Manager, International Tax and Special Projects
RoleDescription:
About the Team
Its an exciting time to join our rapidly growing Tax team and be a part of the fast growth the Company is experiencing, particularly with M&A initiatives and jurisdictional growth! The Tax team is heavily involved in the operations of the business that impact Dashers, Merchants and Customers. As a key partner to the business, we are involved at the front end on plans for new products and country expansions. As DoorDash continues to expand its business lines, product offerings, and global footprint, partnering with the business teams to bring tax awareness for such initiatives continues to grow in importance.
About the Role
We are seeking a key contributor to the Tax team reporting to the Senior Director, International Tax and Special Projects. In this role, the Senior Manager will be a member of the team that performs a variety of functions primarily relating to international tax issues associated with world-wide tax planning projects, including legal entity and intellectual property holding structures, M&A integrations, and international tax law implementations, integrating and coordinating with the compliance, reporting, transfer pricing and controversy teams. We employ a one-team approach, so the Senior Manager will be working closely with internal tax resources in Finland and other international jurisdictions. The ideal candidate will have proven experience working collaboratively with broader business organizations, effectively identifying and communicating complex tax topics to Executives that affect global businesses. We are looking for a great cultural fit that can bring diverse perspectives and experiences. While technical and research abilities are critical, we are seeking an individual that can problem solve and collaborate within a matrixed environment.
Our work environment is fun, fast-paced and rewarding. We provide a unique environment for learning and developing and were looking for an independent, proactive and highly motivated individual. A successful candidate will be able to build successful relationships within Tax and across the broader company, simultaneously manage multiple cross-functional projects, recommend and support the implementation of high-impact planning initiatives supporting business growth, provide tax advice on tax and non-tax initiatives, and communicate complex areas of tax law to Executives within the company.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Project manage US and multinational tax planning projects, corporate restructurings and M&A integrations. 
Provide tax advice within the Tax team and key internal stakeholders throughout DoorDash on strategic tax planning initiatives, legislative developments, and other ad hoc matters.
Analyze and model scenarios to assess tax implications of planning strategies in support of tax compliance and tax provision.
Review all aspects of U.S. international income tax compliance and reporting associated with international tax planning initiatives, including E&P, Subpart F, GILTI, FDII, BEAT and foreign tax credit calculations. 
Provide US international tax support to federal tax compliance and reporting group, tax controversy and transfer pricing teams, international tax partners, and cross-functional teams (e.g., Accounting, Treasury, FP&A, and Legal), as required.
Prepare/review technical and non-technical tax research memos.
Research, analyze, model and communicate the tax technical, economic, business, and financial statement impacts of tax legislation and regulatory proposals to determine the potential or overall impact to the organization.
Manage ad hoc tax projects as required or as needed.
Operate at the lowest level of detail, diving into all things that directly or indirectly impact tax for DoorDashs international landscape to help drive shareholder value and minimize risk.
Communicate with stakeholders at all levels on project plans, status, and important issues.
Design scalable playbooks that document the teams tax policies and procedures. 
Manage external advisors as necessary. 

Were excited about you because...

You have 8+ years of experience in a multinational tax compliance/reporting/planning function with project management, consulting, or related experience.
You have experience managing large consulting, advisory, or other project engagements.
You have a proven track record of managing cross-functional projects with multiple dependencies in a fast-moving environment.
You have demonstrated success in your ability to explain complex tax issues in a clear and understandable manner.
You roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary to drive results, even if it's outside your normal areas of focus.
You have a strong attention to detail and analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills. 
You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills and can motivate people at all levels across a variety of job responsibilities.
You approach your role with a strong moral compass and integrity.

Title: Site Manager
RoleDescription:
About the Team
Were looking for a people-focused leader and experienced warehouse specialist to lead one of our DashMart facilities. DashMart is a new convenience and grocery store from DoorDash, focused on delivering household essentials, favorite snacks, and light groceries right to our customers doorsteps on-demand. 
About the Role
In this role, youll manage a 5-10k sq ft distribution center, the local warehouse operating team, and be responsible for ensuring we maintain high quality for our customers. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead: Recruit, lead, coach & retain a high-performing team of Shift Leads (3+) and Operations Associates (6+). Set your team up for success to work safely and productively. Youll partner with your Shift Leads to effectively delegate daily tasks and ensure high performance from your team.

Youre a proven leader. You have managed high-performance teams of 10+ employees

You solve problems from first principles.  Youre excited to solve problems in innovative ways, and you resist this is how its always been done thinking
Youre unafraid of ambiguity.  Rapid change and learning is exciting to you, and you thrive in ambiguous, startup environments
Youre analytical. You let data win arguments. You are a data-first problem solver and you have experience using Excel or Google Sheets to analyze data, including using basic formulas and creating pivot tables. 
You have 3+ years experience: In Operations, Warehouse Logistics, Retail Management, Fulfillment, or related field
You have 1+ years of experience managing a team
You have a college degree, or relevant professional work experience
You have flexibility in your schedule. As the leader of the site, you will need to ensure your team and the site is fully supported, requiring some late night and weekend availability.

DoorDash Commerce Platform is DoorDashs first software-as-a-service business unit  offering a suite of products and services across online ordering, branded mobile apps, loyalty solutions, and more that enable merchants (restaurants, grocers, retailers, etc.) to reach customers through their own first-party channels.

Title: Senior Territory Account Executive - Denver
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Outside Sales team has been the face of DoorDash to our merchant partners since our founding in 2013. Stationed locally, this team creates deep partnerships with the most coveted local and regional restaurants in any given geography. Our Outside Sales team is the revenue driving arm of DoorDash and ensures the growth of our SMB partnerships which help strengthen operations, accelerate consumer growth, and improve our bottom line.
This is a field sales opportunity based out of the cities specified above. 
About the Role
We are looking for a Senior Territory Account Executive (Strategic Merchant Lead) for the Outside Sales team to establish partnerships with our Local Hero and Local Premium merchants across the region. The key to DoorDashs growth is merchant selection. The more local hero and local premium merchants we add to DoorDash, the faster we will add new customers, the better we will retain existing customers, and the higher our conversion rates will be for customers visiting our app or website You'll be focused on new restaurant acquisitions with a transactional deal cycle and bringing on the best local and regional restaurants onto the DoorDash platform. You will prospect, meet with, and close partnerships with these merchants.
You will report to our Regional Sales Manager on our Outside Sales team. This is a hybrid role with at least 50% travel (2-3 days per week) meeting with prospective clients and 1-2 days working remotely from home/office. We expect this role to be flexible, with some time in office and some time remote. You will need the ability to travel as needed for in-person collaboration through training, offsites, team-building events, and other business-related necessities.
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Have a passion for SMB businesses and the restaurant industry
Sell restaurant owners on the value of partnering with DoorDash and help them understand the value of our full suites of services (e.g. Marketplace, Storefront, Dashpass)
Lead complex negotiations to structure industry-leading and mutually beneficial economic terms
Excel in a transactional deal cycle and closing new business within a few weeks
Use creative strategies in sales processes and prospect outreach
Share on-the-ground insights with sales leadership and operations team
Mentor teammates on how to be the best version of themselves after establishing yourself in the role
Travel into different markets and meet with restaurant owners (hybrid role with up to 50% travel)

We're excited about you because...

You have 3+ years of experience in a closing sales role or related experience
You excel in a transactional deal cycle
You have experience exceeding goals
You have experience selling multi-product solutions
You approach challenges from the fundamentals
You express creative sales tactics to engage with prospects
You have experience using a CRM (Salesforce) and Google Apps
